conversations.content: Day A, Month Y: There, there. Another sobbing tantrum from Emile. ＂Teach that stupid chicken a lesson for me!＂ Jupiter must have teased him again.
Day B, Month Y: Now, now. Cat Sìth and Ebisu are squabbling over who gets to sleep next to me. Silly children! One to my left and one to my right. Now shake hands and make up.
Day C, Month Y: Come, come. You forgot where you left your socks? Midgardsormr, you must manage on your own. You're an old m...you're a grown man now.
Day D, Month Y: My, my. Ranzal paid a visit for the first time in ages. But I cooked him a feast, and he complained! ＂Don't spoil me,＂ he said. ＂You'll ruin me!＂ Just what did he mean by that?
Day D, Month Z: Night, night. Everyone is tuckered out from the day's festivities. Time for bed, everyone! Sleep tight and sweet dreams...
...Are they all asleep?  Good. The dead of the night is my alone time, and I want to hole up in my room and indulge. Ah, but what will I do, you ask?

Eating sweets while binging games at midnight is my own personal paradise—and what gets me through the day! Tomorrow will bring more children in need of looking after, and this helps me be at my best for them.
